summary:
PhD candidate in the group of Molecular Materials and Nanosystems, at the Eindhoven University of Technology.

Through my education, I have learned fundamental principles of energy conversion materials from the perspective of solid-state chemistry and materials science, especially in the field of photovoltaics and optoelectronics.
Experiences in the material synthesis from solution process, the preparation of films by spin coating, dip coating, squeegee, self-assembly, etc. as well as the analysis and characterization of materials by XRD, SEM, TEM, EDX, J-V measurements, and optical measurements such as UV-Vis, PL.

In doctoral education, the main scope of my interest has been slightly shifted from chemistry to physics side. Since my research project deals with not only experimental analyses but also quantum chemical calculations and kinetic Monte Carlo simulations, the field of my study now lies in the integrated area of physics, chemistry, and mathematics, so to speak.
